title: 09A - File Systems and Directories in Operating Systems

questions.question: Files are managed by the operating system.
Which of the following is NOT a responsibility of the file system?
choices: Allowing data to be read and written

questions.question: The part of the OS that manages files is called the file system.
A fileâ€™s symbolic name is stored in:
Which of the following is a typical file attribute?
True or False: File attributes such as location, type, and size vary across operating systems.
Which device type is most commonly used for secondary storage of file systems?
True or False: Disks allow for both sequential and random access to file data.
What system call is used to remove a file?
True or False: Opening a file loads its attributes and disk addresses into memory.
Which operation writes new data into the file at the end?
True or False: The seek system call is used to position the pointer for reading or writing.
What system call retrieves file metadata such as size or creation date?
True or False: Random access allows files to be read at any position using seek.
What type of directory structure contains only one directory for all files?
Which of the following best describes a hierarchical directory structure?
choices: Each file is stored in a database
All files are stored on a magnetic tape
Directories are arranged in a tree structure
Only one user can access directories

questions.question: True or False: Directory allocation and management algorithms affect file system performance.
